videoData.title: Using Aboriginal traditions to teach tech
videoData.socialTitle: Using Aboriginal traditions to teach tech

nodes.whoTheyAre: Michael Mieni, a proud Ngemba, Wangkumara and Barkindji man, is the first-ever Indigenous IT honours student at the University of Technology Sydney, and he’d like to make sure he is the first of many. He enjoys facilitating and volunteering for university outreach programs such as Galuwa, Nanga Mai and works with the Magic Moments Foundation as the Sydney Grandies Coordinator. Since joining Westpac, Mieni has worked as a Technical Business Analyst as well as the Communications Manager for Brothers & Sisters, the Indigenous employee action group. He envisions a connected, united future for Australia, utilizing technology that will provide more opportunities for all of its people.

videoData.description: Michael Mieni is the first-ever Indigenous IT honours student at the University of Technology Sydney, and he wants to make sure he isn't the last: By using Aboriginal traditions to bridge the digital divide in Indigenous communities, he says, we can reveal untapped brilliance.
videoData.socialDescription: Michael Mieni is the first-ever Indigenous IT honours student at the University of Technology Sydney, and he wants to make sure he isn't the last: By using Aboriginal traditions to bridge the digital divide in Indigenous communities, he says, we can reveal untapped brilliance.
